channel.title: RSPS Mirrors - Providing permanent backup to your files
channel.description:
[center][IMG]http://i50.tinypic.com/2ivzpsp.png[/img]
[url=http://rspsmirrors.tk]website[/url] | [url=http://rspsmirrors.x10.mx/contact.html]contact[/url][/center]
[b]What we're about[/b] More and more downloads are now becoming expired or being removed by Jagex. If we are not careful we will lose most of the good server downloads due to this escalating problem. You must admit, it's annoying to find the download you want only to discover that "the file you requested is no longer available". And then you wait for days in hope someone else will upload for you.
Well now you don't have to worry. I'll keep an archive of every single download that is submitted to me or backed up by myself, and in return you will never have to worry about the server download link going down again. uppit, mediafire, rapidshare etc. have proven to be unrealiable, so I believe a dedicated file sharing site for RSPS is essential.
[b]How it works[/b] People can now submit there server to me and I'll create a mirror on my site. The website is just a reference, the actual downloads for the servers are hosted by myself on my home server to avoid any problems. That way I can just drag and drop the files into a folder instead of uploading them to a webserver.
I will be browsing the download sections for the best servers, archiving them and then going around all the others. All server downloads come with an information page that displays credits and general information. If, for whatever reason, you wish to have your server removed then all you have to do is contact me and it will be removed immediately.
[b]What can the community do to help?[/b] If you have a server, client or cache that has been expired via the download link, it would be much appreciated if you could upload it and send it to me via [url=http://rspsmirrors.x10.mx/contact.html]this link[/url]. Or if you'd like your download permanently backed up you can contact me via the same link and follow the instructions.
I do understand the implications of running such a site, and if worse comes to worse I shall just change the link and make it private. I've seen a lot of good downloads become lost due to link expiry and Jagex. With RSPS Mirrors I can guarantee a permanent, direct download to your files.
[b]Safety[/b] All files are scanned with [url=https://www.virustotal.com/]virustotal.com[/url] and [url=http://www.malwarebytes.org/]malwarebytes.org[/url] to ensure no dodgy files get through.
Some of you may not understand the importance of this, or even the point, but I cannot watch all the good servers disappear. If they did, what would we have left? PI?

item.dc:creator: @Doobage Doobage
item.description:
@Doobage wrote:

tbh this seems a bit off, i mean putting collection of sources and clients on a RS based file hosting… I mean access is Most likley there for them, and if u you dont mind your files getting downloaded without ur permission i guess thats fine with you, not saying they will do this but. I think its better to drive to walmart and buy a Flash Drive.

Read full topic

item.title: RSPS Mirrors - Providing permanent backup to your files
item.dc:creator: @RSPS_Mirrors RSPS Mirrors
item.description:
@RSPS_Mirrors wrote:

My internet might of been running slow, it works.

[quote=“ox random xi, post:27, topic:466723”][quote author=Team_Rocket link=topic=583655.msg4155564#msg4155564 date=1352665905]
What’s to stop Jagex from going after you? They’ll be looking to take down as many as possible, and this is bunching them all up in one place.
[/quote][/quote]
There’s nothing stopping them and I fully expect them to. If worse comes to worse I’ll just make the link private.

Read full topic

item.title: RSPS Mirrors - Providing permanent backup to your files
item.dc:creator: @PvPXile PvPXile
item.description:
@PvPXile wrote:

RSPS Mirrors:

Yeah of course and I respect that. I’d also be flattered that people were so passionate to recreate my game. They are not bad people but they sold up to American investors and now we don’t have the game we used to love, to play anymore, which is why it’s important we preserve what we have before it’s all gone.

Why did mopar turn effing into loving -.-

Yeah, ever since Gower handed over development, they ruined the game so they sold out, I agree with the aspect of preserving it though!

OT:I downloaded some shit from your site

Read full topic

item.title: RSPS Mirrors - Providing permanent backup to your files
item.dc:creator: @PvPXile PvPXile
item.description:
@PvPXile wrote:

I live in Cambridge and got a tour inside Jagex Studios, they even gave my friend and I lunch! They’re not as bad as you think, all they’re doing is protecting 10+ years of work. Imagine if you put 10+ years into a project and suddenly everyone had exactly that.

OT:Fucking amazing idea.

Read full topic

You want to pay for it lol?
[/quote]
ads my friend.[/quote]
Ah yes, I knew I forgot something.

arham 4:

Sent you an email for uploading my ‘Arham’s Killer Pack’ in the tools section.

All done, thanks for being the first person to submit a file.

[quote=“Fails, post:20, topic:466723”]I love this idea, I love you, I love this idea, I love you. I love…

Can’t wait to see if this works out![/quote]
Thanks for the love lol.

TheHolyGrail:

Nice idea, hope this works out for you.

Yeah, I got the motivation and time. Just need no hassle from the big guys over in Cambridge. I’m certain though that I can always have the home server open whether the webserver host allows it or not.

Read full topic

item.title: RSPS Mirrors - Providing permanent backup to your files
item.dc:creator: @RSPS_Mirrors RSPS Mirrors
item.description:
@RSPS_Mirrors wrote:

We had over 120 hits today, so if anyone is wondering why the counter is reset, it’s because I implemented it to record unique hits only (page views per IP, per day).

There are also 28 servers available for download now, and counting. I’ll be adding them in batches of about 5-10 at a time.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

RiiPiiNFtW:

I like the whole idea and I like your dedication, but you should really try to add a professional visual appeal to it. It kind of looks half ass and what not to me. If you download the Adobe Dreamweaver CS6 trial, I could give you the crack if you want.

Yh I want da crack

Thanks, I know it’s not very flash at the moment but that wasn’t my main priority. I do plan to build and develop the visual side of things as time goes by, like any website. I have the main skeleton, I just need a reputable amount of downloads available before I work on the visuals.
